rawContent:
Gonna ruffle some $TSLA feathers here.  

But whatever, its twitter. And I'm happy to be proven wrong.

Tesla is a cool company with an awesome product.

But, be very wary of narratives vs. facts.

I've been told time and time again that Tesla's true optionality is outside of cars.  With software, FSD, batteries, solar and green energy.

Auto makes up >85% of top line sales.  It is what it is.  The numbers are gravity which bring you back to reality.

Forward looking narratives and an investment thesis rooted in an optimistic future is great.  But, it needs to be grounded in fundamentals.  End rant.  Open to counter points, learning more and being open minded if you have anything you think I'm getting wrong.

Red = total auto revenues
blue = energy gen + storage
orange = share price
